enb_long_title: Thirteenth Session of the Subsidiary Bodies of the UNFCCC
sentences: Luiz Gylvan Meira Filho, Brazilian Space Agency, outlined the implications of different approaches to including LULUCF on the ability of Parties to mitigate climate change as required under the Protocol.

He noted the current temporary uptake of carbon in the biosphere due to natural effects, and said that under a full carbon accounting approach, Annex I countries would be allowed to emit more than under a business-as-usual scenario.
Delegates then continued discussing the compilation text of country-specific data and information as submitted by Parties.
The EU noted the gaps in existing data, stressing that data was a crucial input to the negotiating process.
AUSTRALIA noted that Annex I countries had the capacity to make adequate carbon measurements, and that the quality was continually improving.

Co-Chair Thorgeirsson then summarized the work carried out thus far, and identified key unresolved issues, including: separating human-induced effects from natural uptake of carbon; the package of eligible additional activities under Article 3.4; and limitations of credits and debits.
